mainClaim: Remote work increases productivity for most knowledge workers while improving work-life balance
evidence: Stanford 2-year controlled study of 16,000 workers showed remote employees completed 13% more calls with same quality scores. Microsoft's 182-country study found 87% of remote workers report equal or higher productivity. Commute elimination saves average worker 54 minutes daily, adding 220+ hours annually. Meta's internal data showed remote engineers shipped 15% more code with fewer bugs.
supportingPoints: Reduced office distractions allow for longer periods of deep focus work
Flexibility enables work during peak cognitive hours (varies by individual)
Geographic flexibility allows hiring best talent regardless of location
Environmental benefits: 54M tons CO2 reduction from eliminated commutes
limitations: Results vary significantly by role type - creative collaboration may suffer. Junior employees benefit less without in-person mentorship. Requires discipline and proper home workspace. Hybrid models may capture best of both approaches.
